Fields.DialogueText: Captain! 'Ave you seen?
Eh? Seen what?
The newspaper! I'm in the newspaper!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not much of a newspaper reader.

Fields.DialogueText: Me neither, but when I saw the article I just had to pick it up!

Fields.MenuText: Just the one?

Fields.DialogueText: For now! With any luck, I'll be in 'em all over the country!

Fields.MenuText: The Daily Mail? I hope it isn't for anything bad.

Fields.DialogueText: How bad could it possibly be?
Let's see... right here, it says "The Belle Manchester has proven herself a steadfast defender of Britain..."
"... but her deplorable fashion sense and unladylike appearance could make her an embarrassment!?"
What a load of tripe!
I'd wondered if they wouldn't appreciate your politics. I just didn't imagine they'd go after your appearance.
These women who wrote the article obviously 'ave no idea what they're on about!
And that's why you're still reading it?
I hafta find out what else they're makin' up!
Just don't obsess over it.
I won't! And would you look at that? A Morgana's volunteered to help me let off some steam!
@BATTLE
I can't believe you're still reading that after what it said about you.

Fields.MenuText: You don't exactly have the most boyish of physiques. I wonder what they'd say about Bulldog...

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
Morbid curiosity, Cap'n. Everythin' they say in here is wrong!
"She shares little of the dignified beauty of Hood or even Ark Royal, and none of the decorum."
"One of the ladies was quite certain she'd spied a rare male Belle before she was duly corrected!"

Fields.MenuText: Ark Royal? "Proper?" They must not have heard her puns.
I mean, you do have more rugged charm than dainty grace.

Fields.DialogueText: They probably mean it like all fancy an' posh.
So what does it matter if I don't 'ave grace?
She confused 'em too, but she gets a pass for her way of talk!
Look, don't let it get to you. It's just one article in one paper by some ladies.
Yeah, I know.
Hey, look - Morgana smashing time. Your favourite time of day, right?
Always does help to clear my 'ead!
Still buried in that newspaper, last I saw her.
She really needs to let it go.
Has anyone seen Manchester today?
Good day, comrades! How does this fine day... er, find you?
... Why, just look at the sky! It's time for the Captain to deal with this.

Fields.MenuText: Did you accidentally damage something again?

Fields.DialogueText: No I have not, my good Cap'-- er, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Who are you and what have you done with Manchester?

Fields.DialogueText: It's still the same old me! Just talking normally, I am!

Fields.MenuText: What on earth are you up to?

Fields.DialogueText: Just thought I would greet you today!
Okay, I'll bite. What's going on? Why are you talking like that?
I just wanted to try speakin' proper for once!
How was it?
Proper awkward.
You're telling me. Why?
Just, er... just tryin' it on for a bit, is all!
Uh-huh...
An' so in case I get to meet Hood I can not sound like a bumpkin.
Right.
Er... hey, look! Morganas!
@BATTLE
Captain! We've company!
Man battle statio--
@BATTLE
... Why are you standing so stiffly?
Oh, er, just tryin' a new posture! Supposed to be good for ya!
Nngh. I don't know how they do this!
Manchester, take a break for your sake.
There! Phew! So much better not stood up like a chip!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know chips could stand up at all.
What's next? A sudden change in clothing?

Fields.DialogueText: Eh... You say that...
It's just a turn o' phrase meanin' to be sat up or stood up really straight, is all!

Fields.MenuText: Somehow I don't think you'd pass for a member of the King's Guard.

Fields.DialogueText: Not tryin' to be! Besides, I couldn't handle wearin' one of those great bloody hats.
What's really going on here?
I know you said not to let the article get to me...
It got to you, didn't it?
I know I do fine as I am, but they're right! I'm not a proper Belle like Hood or even Ark!
I don't think you need to be.
Thanks, but it doesn't help. I need to try an' be like 'em. Maybe then I'll be properly noted.
... All right, then. How can I help?
So as you've noticed, the first thing I was tryin' to correct was my way of speakin'. They singled that out first thing.

Fields.MenuText: To be fair, your handwriting is terrible. It looks like a kid's.
Perhaps they should have tested you on Engels instead of angles.
You're pretty good at math when it comes to kill tallies.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not that useful a skill to 'ave! Besides, it works out! Mostly.
And you saw the way they talked about my education... as if they'd know how I am at maths.
Or angels. That's at least one thing they've got right, about bein' a good ol' Anglican.
Cuz it's a useful task! More important to keep track of than learning a hypernoose!
Hypotenuse.
You're a hypotenuse.
So what is your plan?
Well, they'd recommended some books for helpin' with electrocution.
... Elocution?
That's the one! I figured we'd pick 'em up when next in port.
Sounds simple enough. What's the catch?
There's quite a few Morganas between here and there.
I suppose you wouldn't have it any other way?
You know me so well!
@BATTLE
Makeup!
... Really?
All right, we have the books. Now what's next?
I know, I hate the stuff, but I've seen Hood apply a bit of lipstick here an' there.

Fields.MenuText: Well, if you insist on it.
I thought you looked pretty good without makeup.
Are you just copying whatever Hood does?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd rather not go near there, but anything to become a proper Belle!
For a tomboy, probably. But I've gotta look more... ladylike. Ugh.
Well, it's a good start!
Have you ever even tried putting makeup on before?
Oh, please! How hard could it be? Easy as fighting Morganas! Probably.
And how easy is that?
*ALARM*
Better done than said! Watch and learn!
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap'n! I was wonderin' if you could help me a bit.
What with?
Well, I was wonderin' if you could test my electrocution out.
Elocution.
I'm never gonna get that word. Anyways, here's one o' the books. Ask me one o' the phrases.

Fields.MenuText: "How many haddocks in the haddock paddock?"

Fields.DialogueText: All right, then. Let's see...

Fields.MenuText: "For dinner I will have the special."
"Could you please escort me to the lavatory?"

Fields.DialogueText: 'Ow many 'addocks in the 'addock paddock?
F'r dinner I'll 'ave th' special.
Could ya please show me the loo?
Well?
I's not bad... but if you're trying to sound like the book, you're a long way off.
Ugh, I just wanna throw those books overboard!
I'm sure there's a better way to get rid of them.
*ALARM*
I know! Let's see how the Morganas do bein' pelted by books!
Not what I had in mind.
@BATTLE
It's finally here!
What is?
The makeup I ordered. It's just arrived today!
Let's take a look at it.
Put a pin in it, Cap'n! There's some Morganas nearby on the hunt for a smokey eye!
@BATTLE
Okay, let's open it up!

Fields.MenuText: How much eyeshadow do you need?

Fields.DialogueText: Ya know the smokey eye look I said about earlier? It's quite demandin'!

Fields.MenuText: What's that lavender and honey smell coming from the box?

Fields.DialogueText: Aw, crap! That must be the perfume!

Fields.MenuText: All this and only a single tube of lipstick.

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't sure what to get, so I just got what looked nice.
And you are absolutely sure this is all necessary?
Of course! Lemme go put some of this on and I'll let ya be the judge!
Shouldn't you ask someone to help you?
How hard can it be?
I accidentally walked in on her in the head. Did you tell her to camouflage herself?

Fields.MenuText: I thought lipstick was supposed to only go on your lips.

Fields.DialogueText: Once, sir. This morning.
Anyone seen Manchester?
... All right, spit it out. You're suppressing a grin.
Oi! Clear off before I clear ya off!
Eep!
Camo... ah. I'm starting to put a picture together.
If I might help you paint it...
Out with it. What did he tell you?

Fields.MenuText: Did you bathe in the perfume? I thought I could smell you from anywhere aboard...

Fields.DialogueText: I couldn't smell it when I started, so I kept applyin'!

Fields.MenuText: How much eyeshadow did you cake on there, anyway?

Fields.DialogueText: You try applying it when the ship's rocking about like a great bloody log down a great bloody hill!
I tried to get the smokey look and kept mucking it up!
Maybe you should ask one of the female crew to help next time.
Yeah... you may be right.
Maybe then you won't have to terrify the sailors.
*ALARM*
Shite! I've still gotta clean up in the head!
If we get close enough, you might be able to use your perfume like Morgana Mist.
Oh, ha ha! See if you're immune to that, why don't you...
@BATTLE
Thanks again for helpin', Eloise.
You certainly know your stuff.
Ce n’est pas un problème. I have two younger sisters back home.
Merci, Capitaine. What did you think?

Fields.MenuText: Better than before. I think there was something to the modern art look, though...
She cleans up well. It's shocking.
You might have perfected her tomboy aesthetic.

Fields.DialogueText: Oi! I'll knock you right Cubist for that!
I'll shock those Daily Mail fogies into a proper reassessment!
That was the plan, y'know!
Unfortunately I cannot do much about the smell. She did in fact spill the entire bottle on her.
It ain't my fault the scent floats away on a light breeze!
*ALARM*
Aww, I shoulda kept it on! I bet Eloise's work could weather a battle!
Not what it's for, but appreciated all the same.
@BATTLE
Keep firin'! Let's get our teeth stuck in!
Mon Dieu, Manchester, I told you it was not made for combat!
We've got bigger problems right now!
@BATTLE
Like it was never there.
'Ow do people stand wearin' that stuff if it just comes apart at every touch an' turn?
Most women are not charging into battle with a full face.

Fields.MenuText: I doubt she'll be stopping any time soon.

Fields.DialogueText: An' you'll thank me for it!

Fields.MenuText: Don't some men wear it too?

Fields.DialogueText: An' it'd be just as silly as when women do it!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we should try woad makeup. Turn her into a regular Highlander.

Fields.DialogueText: You been listenin' to Eddy again?
Eddy?
Edinburgh. She'd be all over this if she found out.
Not entirely comfortable in it, then?
It's not really made for me. What do I do now?
I'm sure you'll think of something.
Hmm...
Eep! Don't spook me like that!

Fields.MenuText: I thought you Belles could sense your captains from anywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, Manchester--

Fields.MenuText: I have to admit you do give a cute little squeak when startled.
I'm sure you'll prank me later to get even.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I di'n't know you'd suddenly call out like that!
Eh... me? Cute? Nah.
Sure, just... later later.
What are you hiding?
Now if you'll excuse me...
... Nothin'.
Looks like something. What is it?
Er... Hey, look! Morganas!
Hm? Where?
Oh, that's lucky. There really are Morganas. Lemme stow this and I'll get to fightin'!
@BATTLE
Have you got a sec, Cap'n?
I suppose so. What's up?
I was wonderin' if maybe we could put a dance on.
A dance?
Yeah, like with a small band an' all that.
Why do you want to put on a dance?
Well, I wondered if maybe we might get those newspaper ladies aboard for a proper party.
Maybe then they'll see I'm as proper a Belle as they come!

Fields.MenuText: Do I need to make sure you don't spike the punch?

Fields.DialogueText: You can't tell me the crew di'n't appreciate it! Sure, some got plastered, but I kept an eye on 'em!

Fields.MenuText: I seem to remember someone convincing the cooks to serve everyone beans on toast last time.

Fields.DialogueText: Cheap, cheerful, and easier than grilled fish and whatever else was there before. What's not to like?

Fields.MenuText: What makes you think they'll change their minds?

Fields.DialogueText: The party atmosphere, for one! And they'd get to meet me in person and see how great I really am!
It'll take time to get this set up, you know.
I know! But it'll be worth it when they admit they were wrong and I'm right and proper!
*ALARM*
Do proper Belles fight Morganas?
You bet your arse they do!
@BATTLE
Eh? What about?
How quickly you've thrown yourself behind this whole planning thing.
I'm... surprised.
Well... I might not be the main one behind that.
Capitaine, Manchester asked me to assist her in the party planning.
That is not surprising.
Oi! What's that supposed to mean?

Fields.MenuText: I'm pretty sure your brain stopped working when someone asked about tablecloths.

Fields.DialogueText: He was tryin' to tell me they were two different shades of white when they looked the exact same!

Fields.MenuText: You kept stepping on Lenny's foot while he was teaching you to dance.

Fields.DialogueText: He's not exactly the best teacher, ya know. Swore an awful lot for one!

Fields.MenuText: Did you get a band scheduled for the dance?

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks for remindin' me! Eloise, did ya get a band scheduled for the dance?
Mon Dieu.
Well, regardless, it's getting done and done decently.
Plus it leaves me able to deal with any nosy Morganas!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Of course! I posted the invitation myself!

Fields.MenuText: Did you send it to the right office?

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
Are you sure they'll be coming?
Look, just give it a bit of time! Besides, the party isn't for a few more days!
'Course I did! ... I think.

Fields.MenuText: When did you post it?

Fields.DialogueText: Only a few days ago. Why?

Fields.MenuText: Did you make sure everything was spelled correctly?

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, I'm not a terrible speller! I just have a hard time with longer words, is all!
I guess you're right.
I am some of the time, ya know!
Somehow I knew you'd say that.
They can wait a little bit longer.
Indeed. Don't you have a few more things to finish up for the party?
Welcome aboard, Mrs. Clairbourne!
A pleasure to meet you in person.
Oh, please, call me Shannon! And the pleasure is all mine. To be at a party hosted by a Belle is wonderful!
If you'll follow those sailors there, they'll show you to your quarters.
Thank you so very much, Miss Manchester! I hope to see you round the ship and at the party!

Fields.MenuText: She's one of the ones who wrote the article? She seems friendly enough.
I'm sure you're glad that I posted the invitation for you.
She's much younger than I thought she would be.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't let that deceive you! She's probably only nice cuz you're around.
It's not my fault I got distracted with another battle!
In 'er forties, if she and her co-authors are to be believed. Old enough to know better.
Perhaps we can put all this behind us at the dance.
Speaking of things behind us... I've sensed some Morganas sneakin' around!
Someone should probably warn our guest to keep her head down.
@BATTLE
Keep the door shut!
All right, all right. Still didn't answer my question.
Manchester, what are you doing down here?
I've got my package here I'm to open, but I've waiting on Eloise to help.

Fields.MenuText: Please don't be more makeup.

Fields.DialogueText: No, I've still got plenty lying around. That's for later, anyways.

Fields.MenuText: A thank-you gift, perhaps?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't even know what to get her!

Fields.MenuText: I hope that it isn't a way to prank Shannon.

Fields.DialogueText: Ooh, I'd love to, don't get me wrong.
No, Captain, this is a surprise for the dance.
A good surprise or a Manchester surprise?
All my surprises are good surprises! But yes, hopefully it will be a good surprise.
I hope so, too.
Manchester, prêt?
You bet I'm ready!
*ALARM*
Just give me... ten minutes. Fifteen, tops.
@BATTLE
I for one am not! It is very well done for a Belle of such stock as yourself!
Thank... you?
Wow. I'm surprised at how well this was pulled off.
Please excuse me. I simply must try the punch!

Fields.MenuText: I get the feeling that we've got the wrong woman.

Fields.DialogueText: She's definitely the right one! But I don't know what kind of game she's playing.

Fields.MenuText: I certainly hope it isn't spiked for her sake.

Fields.DialogueText: So what if it is? I'll help everyone loosen up!

Fields.MenuText: Beelining to the punch bowl so early on?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe she's more of a party animal than we gave her credit for!
Maybe you should go talk to her.
That's what I'm plannin' on doin'! I've a surprise for everyone and 'opefully it'll show 'er!
Are you positive it isn't a prank?
It bloody well better not be! You hang on here and keep the party goin'!
Now, I've a couple of party crashers to deal with, and then I'll come back with the surprise!
@BATTLE
Why, wherever did our hostess go off to?
We had some Morgana troubles and--
Ah, I thought I heard the sounds of battle! Giving the enemy what for!
She and I have cooked up a surprise, actually. If you'll follow me...
I still have a sinking feeling she's planning a prank.
*AFTER THE PARTY*
I'm glad I found it! It was hiding so well I couldn't spot it at first!
Oh, how well you looked! Such a contrast with your hair - and no hat, speaking of!
I helped her get the fit right and made sure she didn't make a clown of herself with the makeup.
We had us a shoot for the paper, Cap'n! What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Wow. I mean... wow.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew the dress was a good idea!

Fields.MenuText: Is that the real Manchester?

Fields.DialogueText: I feel like you've 'ad to ask that question a lot, Cap'n! That's all me!

Fields.MenuText: Is it warm in here, or is it just me?

Fields.DialogueText: Bloody dodgy ventilation sometimes.
This ought to seal it on me bein' a proper Belle!
Why, whatever do you--
*ALARM*
Eloise! Quick, let's get me dressed up for the scrap! That'll really raise some eyebrows back home!
Are you quite sure that's--
Sure I'm sure! Less talking, more dressing!
@BATTLE
C'est terrible! Tears and soot everywhere... the hem's singed... Mademoiselle Manchester, I told you this gown was not meant for combat!
Oh, that's just perfect! My best chance to prove myself, gone!

Fields.MenuText: How are you at repairing gowns, Eloise?

Fields.DialogueText: Not like it bloody matters...

Fields.MenuText: You don't need to prove anything to anyone, Manc.

Fields.DialogueText: Says you!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure you'll have other chances.

Fields.DialogueText: Not at this rate...
Anyone can put on a bloody gown! If they could have seen me move and fight in it...
Oh, Miss Manchester! Are you all right? I wanted to check in on you after the battle. It seemed quite savage.
I suppose... I still failed.
You protected us and beat back those awful Morganas! Just what one would expect from a proper Belle!
... 'Scuse me?
You did read the article, didn't you?
'Course I did!
All the way through?
... 'Scuse me a moment. There's a few stragglers I need to mop up.
@BATTLE
See here? We concluded that you were a wonderful example of the everyman Englander.
But what about my appearance?

Fields.MenuText: Didn't you say she lacked the decorum of Hood and Ark Royal?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, of course she does. Those two embody the upper crust of society.

Fields.MenuText: But what you said about her fashion sense and tomboy appearance...

Fields.DialogueText: "Could" make her an embarrassment, mind you. Got to bury the lede with a bit of the inflammatory.

Fields.MenuText: Had any of you seen Manchester when they confused her for a boy?

Fields.DialogueText: Rebecca, to be fair, wasn't wearing her glasses that morning.
So... I'm not a disgrace?
Oh, no, darling! Absolutely not! You, Bulldog, and Hood are the best representatives of the British nation!
Though you really must learn to read the entire article and not just the first paragraph.
Not to mention letting one article get its hooks in you like it did.
Well, depending on the article, mind. Still, your captain has a point.
I, er... need a moment.
*ALARM*
Make it a quick one.
@BATTLE
I see you're all cleaned up from... cleaning up.

Fields.MenuText: Did you throw it out?

Fields.DialogueText: No use walkin' about in a mucked-up gown.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised the makeup held through the last couple of battles.

Fields.DialogueText: Eloise's doing. She found some that was more smudge-resistant. And smoke-resistant. And fire-resistant.
Gave it to Eloise. She mumbled somethin' in French but started on patchin' it up.

Fields.MenuText: Feeling better?

Fields.DialogueText: A bit, thanks.
Shannon's getting off in port. I'm sure she'll have plenty to write about.
I can't believe I di'n't bother reading the whole thing.
That's what happens when you get caught up in things.
Yeah, yeah. I know.
You're a proper Belle, no matter what anyone says. That's what's important.
'S'pose so.
*ALARM*
You always feel better after a battle, anyway.
True enough. Come on, ya Morganas!
@BATTLE
Thank you once again for the lovely time aboard, Manchester!
No problem! And, er... sorry for the misunderstanding.
Oh, it's quite all right! I'll have my colleagues make themselves clearer in the future.
An' I'll be sure to actually read all the way through stuff.
Take care, Miss Manchester!

Fields.MenuText: She seems like a nice person.

Fields.DialogueText: She is, and she managed to put up with me well enough.

Fields.MenuText: Is this going to be a new thing with you? Checking newspapers for stories about you?

Fields.DialogueText: Only a little bit! I only really read for the comics!

Fields.MenuText: I'm genuinely surprised you didn't bother to prank her.

Fields.DialogueText: No worries! I'll make up for lost time later!
I suppose it's back to normal for everyone.
Hey, is she waving at us?
I think she's trying to get our attention.
Oh, look over there! Morganas!
She's got a good eye.
One last show for her 'fore we go!
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap'n?
Hmm?
I got to thinkin'. Durin' this whole time, you kept on about 'ow I was already proper an' all.
Do you really think so?

Fields.MenuText: Why wouldn't I?

Fields.DialogueText: Ya know... bein' a tomboy, not bein' all proper like Hood, the working-class accent an' all...

Fields.MenuText: Why do you ask?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, cuz ya kept bringin' it up an' mentionin' it.

Fields.MenuText: What if I do?

Fields.DialogueText: Depends on what your answer happens to be.
I do, Manchester. Maybe the most proper of them all.
Really?
I mean it.
Eh... heh. Is it warm here, or is it just me?
Well, it does get warm below decks.
You know, I heard that said when I was in my gown the other day.
Did you, now?
I'll come back to this later. I need to deal with some interrupters first.
@BATTLE
Well, she said to meet in my cabin, but where is she?
Hey, Cap'n.
Manchester. I was wondering how long you'd...
There's something different about you.
Yep! I tried my hand at the makeup myself.

Fields.MenuText: It's certainly an improvement.

Fields.DialogueText: Easier to get stuck in than to just talk about somethin', innit?

Fields.MenuText: I think you might have missed a few spots.

Fields.DialogueText: Bit of a learnin' curve. I'm keen to get round it!

Fields.MenuText: I think I still prefer you without makeup.

Fields.DialogueText: Can't blame a girl for tryin'.
I tried it more subtle like. Bit o' lipstick, splash o' perfume. Got to where I barely noticed, but if you do...
I do. What's... all this for?
Well... for all this time, you believed in me even when I didn't believe in myself.
An' you still did your best to help me fix what I thought needed fixin'.
So I figured that fancyin' up a bit doesn't hurt when there's a good reason.
And what reason would that be?
Well, cuz you like seein' me prettied up just as much as normal... I figure I can bear with it. At least a bit.
So does--
Cuz I care what you think, Cap'n. I do. A lot.
Good. Because I feel the same.
Really? I mean... wow!
I wasn't exactly subtle about it.
Guess newspapers aren't the only things I need to read better.
Guess I'm not the only one who needs to learn to get their point across.
*ALARM*
Oh, Cap'n, I'm so happy I could explode!
Why don't we explode some Morganas?
Sounds like a plan!
